snippet: Investors apprehensive about the reopening of the New York Stock Exchange after Hurricane Sandy were pleasantly surprised at the resilience of American markets.
abstract: American markets close with only a slight decline in their first day of trading following two-day shutdown due to Hurricane Sandy; reopening of New York Stock Exchange serves as small sign of reassurance and resilience as much of the Northeast continues to struggle with storm's aftermath.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED
byline.contributor: Susanne Craig and Ben Protess contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Investors apprehensive about the reopening of the New York Stock Exchange after Hurricane Sandy were pleasantly surprised at the resilience of American markets.

headline.seo: New York Stock Exchange’s Ease in Reopening Grabs the Spotlight
headline.main: N.Y.S.E. Reopens Smoothly, Reassuring Global Investors
headline.print_headline: Smooth Reopening of New York Stock Exchange Reassures Investors
